message.content: The generated code currently uses a dictionary to store users and posts. This is not a persistent storage, meaning if the server restarts, all data will be lost. A suggestion to improve this would be to use a database for storing users and posts. This will ensure data persistence even if the server restarts.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The generated code currently does not handle the case where a user tries to register with a username that already exists. A suggestion to improve this would be to add a check in the register endpoint to see if a user with the provided username already exists. If so, return an appropriate error message.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The generated code currently does not have any form of password security. The passwords are stored in plain text which is a security risk. A suggestion to improve this would be to hash the passwords before storing them. This way, even if someone gains access to the database, they won't be able to see the actual passwords.
